content.raw:
See my previous comment with the link that shows how we’re running your container. Note that we’re not running with the `-it` flag, in case you’re relying on your `.bashrc` as an entrypoint. You’ll need an explicity entry point or to write a `/ros_entrypoint.sh` in case you’re using the `ros:melodic-ros-core-bionic` base Docker image. 

Maybe [this tutorial](#!/osrf/vrx/wiki/tutorials/Creating%20a%20Dockerhub%20image%20for%20submission) can help.
content.html:
See my previous comment with the link that shows how we’re running your container. Note that we’re not running with the -it flag, in case you’re relying on your .bashrc as an entrypoint. You’ll need an explicity entry point or to write a /ros_entrypoint.sh in case you’re using the ros:melodic-ros-core-bionic base Docker image.

Maybe this tutorial can help.
